snippet.title: Stocks to watch at Thursday's close
snippet.content: Stocks to watch on the Australian stock exchange: API - AUSTRALIAN PHARMACEUTICAL INDUSTRIES - down 23 cents, or 13.07 per cent at $1.53 The drugs distributor and pharmacies supplier's lowered its profit growth forecasts on Wednesday due to weaker consumer spending. FLT - FLIGHT CENTRE - up $1.54, or 3.5 per cent, at $45.94 Flight Centre has continued its expansion strategy, acquiring a travel operator based in Canada's Quebec province for an undisclosed sum. KMD - KATHMANDU - steady at $2.10 Strong winter sales growth in Australia and New Zealand will boost the outdoor clothing retailer's profit by up to 13.4 per cent. SUN - SUNCORP - down 93 cents, or 6.4 per cent, at $13.57 Suncorp's annual profit rose four per cent to $1.08 billion, as gains in the Australian insurance business helped offset lower margins in banking and a fall in its New Zealand unit's profit. WHA - WATTLE HEALTH - up 21.5 cents, or 37.1 per cent ,at 79.5 cents The infant formula supplier will raise up to $12.4 million to fund a recent acquisition and joint venture. CBA - COMMONWEALTH BANK - down 26 cents, or 0.3 per cent, at $83.97 Commonwealth Bank has been accused of more than 53,000 breaches of laws put in place to combat money laundering and the financing of terrorism.
